Pre-Game Insights: The Mets offense has been hot and cold, but their recent eight-run performance in Game 1 suggests they’ve found their rhythm.
The Brewers’ offense has shown flashes of power, but their pitching staff has struggled to contain the Mets.
The over is 4-2 in the Mets’ last six games as favorites.
Milwaukee has hit the over in five of their last eight home games.
The over has hit in three of the last four matchups between the Mets and Brewers.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Mets and Brewers have faced off seven times in the regular season, with the over hitting in four of those games.
The Brewers have scored four or more runs in five of their last seven home games.
Others: Sean Manaea will start for the Mets with a 12-6 record, a solid 3.47 ERA, and an excellent 1.08 WHIP.
Frankie Montas will take the ball for Milwaukee in this do-or-die game with a 7-11 record and a 4.84 ERA.
